questions.question: A rectangle has a length of 25 cm and a width of 16 cm. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Perimeter of rectangle = 2(length + width) = 2(25 + 16) = 2(41) = 82 cm

questions.question: The area of a square is 196 square meters. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Area of square = side² = 196. Therefore, side = √196 = 14 meters. Perimeter = 4 × side = 4 × 14 = 56 meters

questions.question: A circle has a radius of 11 cm. What is its area? (Use π = 22/7)
questions.explanation: Area of circle = πr² = (22/7) × 11 × 11 = 378 cm²

questions.question: The perimeter of a regular hexagon is 54 cm. What is the length of each side?
questions.explanation: In a regular hexagon, all sides are equal. Perimeter = 6 × side length. Therefore, side length = 54 ÷ 6 = 9 cm

questions.question: A triangle has sides of length 8 cm, 15 cm, and 17 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: This is a right-angled triangle (8-15-17). Area = (1/2) × base × height = (1/2) × 8 × 15 = 60 cm²

questions.question: The area of a rectangle is 168 square meters and its length is 14 meters. What is its width?
questions.explanation: Width = area ÷ length = 168 ÷ 14 = 12 meters

questions.question: A circle has a diameter of 22 cm. What is its circumference? (Use π = 22/7)
questions.explanation: Circumference = π × diameter = (22/7) × 22 = 68 cm

questions.question: The area of a parallelogram is 96 square centimeters and its height is 12 centimeters. What is its base?
questions.explanation: Base = area ÷ height = 96 ÷ 12 = 8 cm

questions.question: A square has the same perimeter as a rectangle with length 18 cm and width 14 cm. What is the area of the square?
questions.explanation: Perimeter of rectangle = 2(18 + 14) = 64 cm. Side of square = 64 ÷ 4 = 16 cm. Area of square = 16 × 16 = 256 cm²

questions.question: The area of a trapezium is 150 square meters. Its parallel sides are 20 meters and 30 meters. What is its height?
questions.explanation: Area of trapezium = (1/2)(sum of parallel sides) × height. Therefore, height = (2 × area) ÷ (sum of parallel sides) = (2 × 150) ÷ (20 + 30) = 300 ÷ 50 = 6 meters

questions.question: A regular pentagon has a perimeter of 55 cm. What is the length of each side?
questions.explanation: In a regular pentagon, all sides are equal. Side length = perimeter ÷ 5 = 55 ÷ 5 = 11 cm

questions.question: The circumference of a circle is 88 cm. What is its area? (Use π = 22/7)
questions.explanation: Circumference = 2πr = 88. Therefore, r = 88 ÷ (2 × 22/7) = 14 cm. Area = πr² = (22/7) × 14 × 14 = 616 cm²

questions.question: A rectangle has a perimeter of 54 cm and a width of 12 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Perimeter = 2(length + width). Therefore, length = (54 ÷ 2) - 12 = 15 cm. Area = length × width = 15 × 12 = 174 cm²

questions.question: The area of a rhombus is 84 square centimeters and one of its diagonals is 14 centimeters. What is the length of the other diagonal?
questions.explanation: Area of rhombus = (1/2) × product of diagonals. Therefore, other diagonal = (2 × area) ÷ given diagonal = (2 × 84) ÷ 14 = 12 cm

questions.question: A circle has an area of 616 square centimeters. What is its radius? (Use π = 22/7)
questions.explanation: Area = πr² = 616. Therefore, r² = 616 ÷ (22/7) = 196. Therefore, r = √196 = 14 cm

questions.question: The perimeter of a rectangle is 46 cm and its area is 120 square centimeters. What are its dimensions?
questions.explanation: Let length = l and width = w. Then 2(l + w) = 46 and l × w = 120. Solving these equations gives l = 15 cm and w = 7 cm

questions.question: A regular octagon has a perimeter of 80 cm. What is the length of each side?
questions.explanation: In a regular octagon, all sides are equal. Side length = perimeter ÷ 8 = 80 ÷ 8 = 10 cm

questions.question: The area of a triangle is 48 square centimeters and its base is 12 centimeters. What is its height?
questions.explanation: Area of triangle = (1/2) × base × height. Therefore, height = (2 × area) ÷ base = (2 × 48) ÷ 12 = 8 cm

questions.question: A square and a rectangle have the same area. The rectangle has length 24 cm and width 6 cm. What is the perimeter of the square?
questions.explanation: Area of rectangle = 24 × 6 = 144 cm². Side of square = √144 = 12 cm. Perimeter of square = 4 × 12 = 48 cm

questions.question: The circumference of a circle is 75.36 cm. What is its diameter? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Circumference = π × diameter. Therefore, diameter = circumference ÷ π = 75.36 ÷ 3.14 = 24 cm

questions.question: A parallelogram has a base of 18 cm and a height of 12 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Area of parallelogram = base × height = 18 × 12 = 216 cm²

questions.question: The area of a circle is 153.86 square centimeters. What is its radius? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Area = πr² = 153.86. Therefore, r² = 153.86 ÷ 3.14 = 49. Therefore, r = √49 = 7 cm

questions.question: A rectangle has a length of 21 cm and an area of 189 square centimeters. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Width = area ÷ length = 189 ÷ 21 = 9 cm. Perimeter = 2(length + width) = 2(21 + 9) = 60 cm

questions.question: The perimeter of a square is 68 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Side length = perimeter ÷ 4 = 68 ÷ 4 = 17 cm. Area = side² = 17 × 17 = 285 cm²

questions.question: A triangle has sides of length 9 cm, 40 cm, and 41 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: This is a right-angled triangle (9-40-41). Area = (1/2) × base × height = (1/2) × 9 × 40 = 180 cm²

questions.question: The area of a rectangle is 192 square meters and its width is 12 meters. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Length = area ÷ width = 192 ÷ 12 = 16 meters. Perimeter = 2(length + width) = 2(16 + 12) = 56 meters

questions.question: A circle has a radius of 12 cm. What is its circumference? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Circumference = 2πr = 2 × 3.14 × 12 = 75.2 cm

questions.question: The area of a trapezium is 180 square centimeters. Its parallel sides are 20 centimeters and 40 centimeters. What is its height?
questions.explanation: Area of trapezium = (1/2)(sum of parallel sides) × height. Therefore, height = (2 × area) ÷ (sum of parallel sides) = (2 × 180) ÷ (20 + 40) = 360 ÷ 60 = 6 cm

questions.question: A square has an area of 289 square centimeters. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Side length = √289 = 17 cm. Perimeter = 4 × side = 4 × 17 = 68 cm

questions.question: The circumference of a circle is 94.2 cm. What is its radius? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Circumference = 2πr = 94.2. Therefore, r = 94.2 ÷ (2 × 3.14) = 15 cm
